alert.note: Alert for Cedar (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 9:42PM CDT until July 05 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT FOR CEDAR AND SOUTHEASTERN JONES COUNTIES... At 941 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Stanwood, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Tipton, Durant, Mechanicsville, Stanwood, Lowden, Wyoming, Oxford Junction, Bennett, Buchanan, Clarence, Cedar Valley, Massillon Park, Cedar Bluff, Oxford Mills, Bennett Park, Sunbury, Cedar Valley Park, Tipton Matthews Airport and Cedar County Fairgrounds. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
